timeline.title: Agreement Effective Date
timeline.description: Agreement takes effect upon approval by COMMISSION governing board and notification to proceed by Contract Manager.

timeline.title: First Progress Report and Invoice Submission
timeline.description: CONSULTANT must submit first written progress report with invoice within 45 days of work performance.

timeline.title: Mid-Term Review
timeline.description: COMMISSION conducts mid-term performance review based on progress reports and deliverables.

timeline.title: Final Deliverable Submission
timeline.description: CONSULTANT submits all final deliverables for acceptance by Contract Manager.

timeline.title: Final Invoice Submission Deadline
timeline.description: CONSULTANT must submit final invoice within 60 days of work acceptance.

penalty_forecast.description: Late payment penalty for invoice submission beyond 45-day window
Penalty for exceeding milestone cost estimates without approval
Termination for default penalties including reprocurement costs

narratives.title: Late Invoice Submission Scenario
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT misses 45-day invoice deadline
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT performs work in June but fails to submit invoice by July 15 deadline. COMMISSION delays payment and issues written notice. After 10 days without cure, COMMISSION may terminate agreement under Section 4.B. CONSULTANT incurs reprocurement costs and loses future business opportunities.

narratives.title: Insurance Lapse Scenario
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT fails to maintain required insurance coverage
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT's commercial general liability insurance expires during contract term without renewal. COMMISSION discovers lapse during routine audit and immediately terminates agreement under Section 6.B.5. CONSULTANT is liable for all costs incurred due to termination and may face legal action for breach.
key_points: Insurance must be maintained throughout term

narratives.title: Successful Project Completion
narratives.subtitle: All milestones met on time and within budget
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT submits all progress reports and invoices on schedule, maintains required insurance, and delivers all work products by December 15. COMMISSION accepts work and processes final payment within 60 days. CONSULTANT receives full compensation and establishes good standing for future contracts.

risk_alerts.message: Failure to maintain required insurance coverage allows immediate termination without cure period
Late invoice submission beyond 45-day window may result in payment delays and termination risk
Unauthorized subcontracting or personnel changes without written approval constitutes material breach
Exceeding milestone cost estimates without prior written approval triggers financial penalties
